The PFM-1 used to be a standard-issue anti-personnel mine of the Red Army, employed mainly during the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan. A large number of these mines have made their way into the Zone and is highly valued for its functionality, user-friendliness, compact size and low weight.

Improvised explosive device based on OG-7V warhead and parts of a car battery. In the Zone, IEDs are quite popular and Zoners use them for a variety of purposes, from gaining access to closed areas, to ambushes.

Improvised explosive device produced from various chemical substances. This IED is significantly more powerful than the more common OG-7V version. In the Zone, IEDs are quite popular and Zoners use them for a variety of purposes, from gaining access to closed areas, to ambushes.

Heavy metal gas balloon. In the Zone, such canisters often contain a composition of methane, propane, ethane and butane, and can be used for cooking, though some Zoners have found alternate ways of utilizing the jerrycans, namely, as improvised explosives. Upon direct hit, the canister will catch fire and explode after a slight delay.

Emptied heavy metal gas balloon. In the Zone, such canisters often contain a composition of methane, propane, ethane and butane, and can be used for cooking as well as combat purposes. Though empty, it can still be put to good use in outfit maintenance.

A small and moderately heavy metal can filled with a mixture of explosive industrial chemicals, metal bolts and nuts as well as black gunpowder retrieved from old ammunition. Upon direct gunfire, the can will instantly explode with metal bolts and corrosive chemicals bursting out in every direction.

A large metal can filled with E95 gasoline. Usable as a high-tier cooking fuel though some Zoners have found alternate ways of utilizing the jerrycans, namely, as improvised explosives. Upon direct hit, the canister will catch fire and explode after a slight delay.
